result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justina Mae Flones

records.addlTxt: Order Accepting DEJ Count 1
Order Accepting DEJ Count 1

11:31 AM Defendant Justina Mae Flones appeared by video.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Justina Mae Flones.  Attorney Ruth Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Parties have agreement.  Def waives right to personal appearance.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Def understands charges and range of potential penalties.  Atty def pleads NO CONTEST, def agrees.  Atty and def admit that domestic act.  File contains PLQ and DEJ, understands information, rights giving up, and elements.  Def asks court to accept and make DEJ order of the court.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts NC pleas.  As a factual basis can court rely on the information in the complaint, parties agree.  Court finds a factual basis exists, finds def GUILTY and direct judgment to enter.  State comments on sentencing.  Atty comments on sentencing.  See attached for sentencing.  Ct makes DEJ order of the court.

records.addlTxt:
9:19 AM Defendant Justina Mae Flones appeared by video.  Attorney Ruth Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Justina Mae Flones.   Attorney has received copy of CC, waives right to preliminary hearing.  Def has discussed with attorney about waiving rights.  Def and attorney in break out room.  Back on the record 9:32 appearances are the same.  Attorney does wish to waive rights of preliminary.  Def agrees.  Def waives right to preliminary hearing.  Attorney is satisfied.  Court is satisfied,  finds def knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily waiving rights, and accepts rights waiver.  Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed in Ashland county, case is bound over for arraignment.  State has filed information, contains same charges.  Atty at a later date for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
  Def to have NO Contact w/ K.G.S or his resd. NC within 1000 ft of any place K.G.S is at
